page.title: 04The Town Centre, Corby.
page.content: Corby's town centre was originally planned in the 1950's and so today is considerably out of date, although there have been numerous attempts to update it. Originally there were two rows of shops along the main street with a market and bus station at one end. In the 1970's the main street was pedestrianised allowing safer shopping and a new development which included shops and offices, a library, cinema and multi-storey car park was built. This is known as Queen's Square. The later development of a large supermarket completed the facilities. The area has been given covered walk- ways but because it is on a split level catches the wind. Plans were unveiled this year to completely enclose the centre but the decision by the District Council to build a new shopping centre has jeopardised these plans.
